Another approach to reduce the catalyst costs is the synthesis of core–shell NPs with the shell made of a noble metal and the core consisting of an earth-abundant materials. Tackett et al. proposed NPs with an Ir shell and a core consisting of Fe 4N. Because of the inability of iridium to form nitrides, Ir segregates to surface and a stable catalyst structure is expected. Operando XAS studies at the Ir L 3-edge and Fe K-edge confirmed that the nitride core remained stable under OER conditions, while Ir–Fe bonding was confined only to NP surface.
